item.description:
I'd like to cover 2 peaks in VT which are listed in NE HH (New England 100 Highest) on 11/6-7 weekend. This is Day-1 event which covers Stratton mountain (3936 ft), Manchester, VT. After this 2days event, I'll be completed all the high peaks in VT in NEHH list. The rest of my remained peaks are either in NH or ME to complete the list.

Stratton is ski resort mountain at its North side and Long Trail & Appalachian Trail go through Stratton summit. This event covers Stratton summit, Fire Tower as well as Stratton Pond as Loop hike with 2 main trails - Long Trail (=AT) and Stratton Pond Trail.



Car Spotting/Hiking Plan:

* Meetup location(Car spot): Stratton Pond Trail TH parking lot on Stratton-Arlington Road at 8AM.
This is located approximately 0.2 miles East from the junction of Stratton-Arlington Road and USFS 71 in Stratton, VT. This is car spot location. Once everyone meet here, we drive some cars approx. 0.9 miles East onto the parking lot of Long Trail TH on Stratton-Arlington Road.

* We start hiking no later than 8:25AM.
* Hike in 3.8 miles from the parking lot to Stratton Summit
(LT/AT North, elevation gain 1706 ft)
* Hike out 3.1 miles from Stratton summit to Stratton Pond
(LT/AT North, elevation loss 1316 ft)
* Hike out 3.7 miles from Pond to the Parking lot.
(Stratton Pond Tr, elevation loss 390 ft)

Total hiking mileage is 10.6 miles. I'd like to complete this hike within 6-7 hours with 1.5-1.8 mph hiking pace.

If weather doesn't cooperate, I may change this hiking route plan to the shortest one which is 7.6 miles as RT hike on LT/AT.




The estimated Sunrise time at Stratton, VT on 11/6 is around 7:33AM. Sunset is 5:37PM.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------


As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

Weather check point is 11/5, around 5PM.

If you have any question regarding this event as well as accommodation nearby etc., please drop me an email.

Looking forward to meeting/hiking with all of you,

Event Organizer,
Tomoko Nakajima
item.name: Southern VT hike Day 1 - Stratton Mtn & Stratton Pond Hike (NE HH)
